page.title: 03Industrial Estate,Kirkcaldy
page.content: The{Hayfield Industrial Estate}was opened in the 1960s to help with the rising unemployment after the closing of the huge linoleum factories. There are sixteen units which provide a wide variety of services. There are depots for National companies such as British Telecom and for local firms like Douglas Grant the fish-merchant or the Co-op. Several are manufacturing goods like children's clothing, double glazing, concrete products or wooden tables and doors. Fife Regional Council occupy one site with their works department.One is engaged in repairing and re-covering furniture and there are two scrap metal yards. One edge of the estate there is a garage selling cars and a tyre and battery supplier.
